page.title: 06ARABLE FARMING IN WEST CAMBS
page.content:
The area is predominantly agricultural, with most of the land devoted to arable farming. Cereal crops, especially barley and wheat, are grown extensively, with peas, beans and oilseed rape as change crops.
On the outskirts of Catworth, a small farm specialises in the growing of soft fruit, which is marketed at the farm shop or on a 'pick your own' basis.
Farms are large, but the highly- mechanised farming methods used mean that comparatively few workers are employed.
Approximately half the farmland is privately owned and the remainder rented.
